page.title: 02A Visitor's View of Dinas
page.content:
{During April 1985 two children from {New Zealand spent a short time at our {school.Here is what one of them {thought of our area. }
I think of Dinas as a well cultivated,clean area.I think that it has lovely farmland and meadows and paddocks.I also think that the people there are always cheery and pleasant,polite people. The school is a friendly place as well.I also believe that it is good of them to learn to speak as much Welsh as they can so that the language never dies out. Dinas is a very quiet and pretty village and I like it a lot. { {Sian Bennett - a visitor from New {Zealand
